Calling the packages 

```{r message=FALSE}
library(dplyr) # manipulate dataframes
library(readr) # read/write dataframes
library(ggplot2) # making plots
```

Import the crime data
```{r}
library(readr)
bmore_crime_data_6_22 <- read_csv("C:/Users/araku/Dropbox/policy analysis/Summer Class/bmore crime data_6_22.csv")

bmore_crime_data_6_22

```
View(bmore_crime_data_6_22)
CLEANING

1. Make sure all variables are the right type 

*will clean time permitting 
*skipped to making a visual 

x. Making a visual w ggplot
```{r}
graph_data <- bmore_crime_data_6_22 %>%
  filter(Description == "Larceny" && "Larceny from Auto" && "Burglary") %>%
  group_by(District) %>%
  summarise(n_incidents = n()) %>%
ungroup()

graph_data
```

```{r layout="l-body-outset"}
ggplot(data = graph_data) +
  aes(x = District, y = n_incidents)
   geom_col()
```
